Authors:
Bandarupalli devadatha, Mark Calabon, Pranami Abeywickrama,
Kevin D Hyde, GARETH JONES
Title:
Introducing a new holomorphic marine fungus Halobyssothecium
estuariae sp. nov and an asexual morph link to Keissleriella
phragmiticola based phenotypic and molecular data
Keywords:
1 new taxon, Salt marsh plants, Marine fungi, Cryptic
species, Taxonomy
Abstract:
This study introduces a novel holomorphic marine species,
Halobyssothecium estuariae, a fungus on dead Phragmites communis. The
new species is characterized by semi-immersed, subglobose or
ellipsoidal, papillate, conical ascomata, clavate to subcylindrical,
short pedicellate asci and 3-septate, fusoid to ellipsoidal ascospores
with rounded ends, and pale brown to dark brown central cells and
hyaline end cells. The asexual morph has multiseptate, filiform,
intercalary, catenate, branched chlamydospores that resemble Xylomyces.
The asexual morph of Keissleriella phragmiticola based on combined LSU,
SSU, ITS and TEF1 sequence analyses, is reported. The role of molecular
identification in delineating cryptic species are also discussed.
